s.text: The paper says Ford was motivated by Volvo's strong brand image based on safety and because the average Volvo sells for $35,000, twice that of the average Ford.

An Army Ranger is no doubt deserving of an ample extra reward when he's jumping out of planes and sleeping in a foxhole, but not when he's serving as a clerical assistant at the Pentagon, returning to his nice suburban home every night in time for dinner with his family.
A WP editorial decries the Senate Armed Services Committee's approval of increases in military pay and pensions even more generous than those recommended in the new Clinton budget.
(But the LAT notes a possible obstacle: the House managers are continuing to press for live testimony.)

The meaning of the votes is best summed up by the WP , which states that the Senate has told the House managers they have the chance to make their case and that in all likelihood doing so will not matter.
